doc:
Michel Duchaussoy https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michel_Duchaussoy 0 Michel Duchaussoy (29 November 1938 – 13 March 2012) was a French film actor, who appeared in more than 130 films between 1962 and 2012. He was born Michel René Jacques Duchaussoy in Valenciennes, France on 29 November 1938. At first a theater actor, he worked for many years in the Comédie Française, where he started his career in 1964.Duchaussoy performed in many French classic plays including those by Molière, Marivaux, Corneille and Ionesco. He received the prestigious Molière award for best supporting actor in 2003. The deep-voiced actor dubbed Marlon Brando in the French version of Francis Ford Coppola's The Godfather. In 2010 he co-starred with Sophie Marceau in Yann Samuell's L’age de raison. Michel_Duchaussoy ( 29_November_1938 – 13_March_2012 ) was a_French_film_actor , who appeared in more_than_130_films between 1962_and_2012 . Duchaussoy performed in many_French_classic plays_including those by Molière , Marivaux , Corneille and Ionesco . He received the_prestigious_Molière_award for best_supporting_actor in 2003 . The_deep-voiced_actor dubbed Marlon_Brando in the_French_version of Francis_Ford_Coppola 's_The_Godfather . In 2010 he co-starred with Sophie_Marceau in Yann_Samuell 's_L’age de raison .
